intro: Cyphia undulata var. linarioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaf cyphia, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, Mediterranean-type climates. It is often found in coastal or mountainous regions where it thrives in full sun. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
